result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Cuevas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Credit for 1 day time served.
Extended supervision and probation conditions the same.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges, due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during extended supervision and collected by DOC, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that due to DV conviction under federal law, the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction, the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim and residence unless approved by agent or court.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Upfront with Huber release for work and treatment. Court allowed defendant to report to the House of Correction by 5:00pm on 11/28/2014. Defendant advised any violations during upfront condition time or failure to report will result in loss of Huber release.
STAYED pending review on May 1, 2015 at 1:30pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel Cuevas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Miguel Cuevas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent also in Court.  Defendant doing well on Probation.  No further reviews are required.  Defense request for early release from Probation if defendant has successfully completed Probation heard and denied.
subpoena

Defendant Miguel Cuevas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 24 MONTHS, consecutive, credit for 1 DAY time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 9 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS. **Serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, Upfront with Huber Release for work, and treatment. Court allowed defendant to report to the House of Correction by: 5:00 PM on 11/28/2014. Defendant advised any violations during upfront condition time, or failure to report will result in loss of Huber Release.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve an additional 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim and residence unless approved by agent or court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. If Revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision and collected by DOC, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Sentencing Referral Form, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Letter's on behalf of defendant.
State Subpoena

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea neogtiations, on a motion of the state, the court orderd Count 1 Dismissed, but Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant must provide a DNA sample, and is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Court VACATED Jury Trail date. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Miguel Cuevas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered the repeater enhancer (939.62(1)(b) REMOVED from Count 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Miguel Cuevas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado.  Parties working toward resolution of this matter. Court set matter for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial, parties can use Final Pretrial as a plea hearing if needed. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miguel Cuevas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled.  Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado.  Court reviewed and returned certified records. Court found probable cause.  Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case set for Scheduling at defense counsel request.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Reyes in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called defendant not in court, defense counsel advised court there was miscommunication regarding court date. Case passed to 1:30 pm.

Defendant Miguel Cuevas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Irene E Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40, branch 40 in trial, unable to hear case. 
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Court advised this matter is assigned to ADA Matthew Puthukulam, per Chief Judge directive, case is now reassigned to branch 23, Judge Grady. 
Parties ready to proceed.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Discussion regarding probable cause, court made record of issues concerning probable cause. Per stipulation of the parties case is adjourned for Further Proceedings to address  probable cause and handle arraignment if probable cause is found. Defense waived time limits. State's witnesses excused from hearing.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms and Absolute Sobriety.
 Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maria G-D., Andrea C., C.C. and Karen W-A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.

Defendant Miguel Cuevas in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM020582  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
 04-13-14
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Miguel Cuevas not in court.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
$500 cash bail posted. Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/16/14 at 1:30pm.
